review_title: Might be a good game - but sucks
one_reviews_text:
You need a partner to play with ... and down it goes:
You have to try 5 times to find a matching partner.. each time costs you about 10 minutes. You might not even find anyone for a whole day. I installed it a few weeks ago, tried it a few times. Without any success. A few days ago I tried again... it worked 2 or 3 times (with long long long waits for ONE partner - not even team agains team). Then you can play about 3 or 4 minutes and then... wait another 50 minutes (or do something else, but you could miss a match).
I once was paired with a partner (yeah ... celebration... rare like a birthday... awaited the game...) but the partner did go offline in the meantime. This thing is so frustrating... Probably deinstall... if the developers don't fix it. 
When you are waiting for a partner... you really have to wait... stand there and watch... you can't go into a robot... you can't go around... you just have to wait... a long long time... for perhaps nothing. If the payed game is the same, then it would be a waste of money... so not buying it.

Feeling like you're piloting a mech is great fun! You can focus power on four different things: attack power, shield power, speed, and how fast your energy gauge fills. 

At certain energy levels, you can activate two different abilities. Each mech has its own. This can make for some frantic moments to focus on shield or attack power, when you're on the defense/offense. 

Unfortunately, there aren't a whole lot of players online. I could see tournaments being a fun thing.

IThis game looked like fun and I was looking forward to trying it out before I buy it.   However the tutorial is just a bunch of text to read and the only option is to play.   But like other reviewers have said Noone is online.   I saw 2 people searching for 2v2 matches.   Even if I were not one of the 2 that is only 3 people and not enough to play.   

Devs if you are reading this you need to add a single player tutorial where a player gets to try out the mech and even if it is to shoot a dummy.   Give us an idea what the controls are going to be like and the game play wihtout having to wait for somone online in a pool of noone.

review_title: One of the best VR games ever made!!
one_reviews_text:
Real walking with thumbsticks, no teleport!
Incredible graphics!
Destructable environments
Awesome weapons
Awesome mechs
liquid smooth, (dont go by the youtube video, download and try it!)
Great sound and music
Voice chat
1v1, 2v2 for free
Built for the Oculus Touch controllers, so everything works just right
Absolutely ZERO VR sickness
Fully adjustable graphic details. I have mine set on max for everything and im getting perfectly rock solid 90FPS.
Perfect and natural feeling gameplay.
Super fast load times into the main game lobby area and also super fast loading into the 1v1 and 2v2 actual game. I dont yet own the full version, but I assume it will be equally fast loading into 3v3, 4v4 and campaign modes. 
FREE!!!!! (for 1v1 and 2v2). 

Yes, I wish more VR developers would offer a piece of their game for free like this so we could try it out and see if we like it before buying. I happen to REALLY like this, so I will be buying it! It is crazy to purchase a full priced VR game before buying. Some games have wacky controls, poor gameplay, choppy framerate, VR sickness problems or other bugs that dont show up in a youtube video. This game is about as perfect as you can get for every aspect.

If I could, I would give an extra 6th star to the rating of this game for the developers making this demo portion free. It really is that important for VR games to include a playable demo. Thats how games used to be in the Doom1 and Wolfenstien games.. the first few levels were free so you could try the game out and see if it works well on your computer and see if you enjoy playing it.

I would recomend playing this free demo and trying for yourself.
The only thing I would add to this amazing game would be a nice VR lobby to hang out in, add friends, chat, team up or just relax in. As it is now, the lobby is just a map select screen where you can chat while looking at the names of the other players waiting for the game to start. 

GREAT GAME! I love it!
review_feedback: Thank you so much for the kind words and we love that you love it! Join the community on our Discord: https://discord.gg/6qhKkR - See you on the battlefield Pilot!

review_title: This is what vr is for
one_reviews_text: I really enjoyed the free demo part of this game and if I ever get enough money will def buy. The controls are great and smooth. The graphics are amazing. I dont get sick when the robot moves forward. In the free mode it took maybe 3 to 5 minutees to find matches but I met some great people and ended up joining the discord. The community behind this game is very nice, helpful and just fun to play with. The discord also lists the peak times the game is currently getting players which was a huge help. This is the type of game I have wanted vr for because who has ever watched gundam and said I wish I could pilot one of those,  well heres your chance. Love everything about this game!!
review_feedback: Glad you love it! Discord is a must after our player spike at launch its a great way to find other players! https://discordapp.com/invite/aahellfire

one_reviews_text: This game in MP is just simply incredible - I've played so many games BUT this is just out of this world GREAT!! The Mechs feel incredible and the PvP aspect is competitive and just off the wall - TRY IT OUT!!
Wanted to try this out first before buying, but cant do anything as there are no players, not even a tutorial to get a feel for the mech as the tutorial is a slide show.

There is no way to play this in single mode, not even with AI or the like. And waiting for a match takes too much time. Sorry, but deinstalled without any chance of testing. 
If the producers want to encourage players to buy the full version, there should at least be a way to test it.

Sorry you are having issues finding players. Discord is a must after our player spike at launch its a great way to find other players! https://discordapp.com/invite/aahellfire

Also we have a new update coming!

review_title: Skeptical at first...but this is amazing
one_reviews_text: Naturally a little hesitant after reading some reviews BUT THIS IS MY CHILDHOOD DREAM. This game is awesome. I'm not really interested in the single player stuff (I hear it's rail based) but the multiplayer is a lot of fun. There is a lot of tactical stuff behind customizing the mech in game during battle (for example, I crank the speed up to return to a battlefield after dying, or jack up my defense when I'm low on health). It's ultra fun. Even though there were only 30 people online the longest I waited for a game was 3 minutes. In response to other complaints about not knowing how to play - read the tutorial. For developers, a interactive tutorial might be a good addon (like Lone Echo does) for people who dont want to take the time to read. But maaaaaaaan when you enter that lobby and the mechs are all lined up and the music is cranking....it gets you pumped UP. I'm surprised how well the graphics looked running with a gtx 1060. Also destructible enviornments? Oh yeaaaa. Nothing beats bringing a building down when your opponent is hiding behind it.
review_feedback: So awesome to turn more people into mech pilots!

review_title: It's a nice looking menu... is that it?
one_reviews_text:
I'll be honest. The menu system is neat. Selling the scale of the giant robots in the background. but other than navigating menus. Am I supposed to be able to do something more? I don't know people to do a private match with. And when I try the death-match I get to the point of selecting 2v2 or 1v1... but I cannot get any further. I try flopping my hands at the two options. It sounds like it recognises the intersection between the hands and the button but nothing happens. I try grabbing it... (feels unnatural for a menu, but maybe that's just me and it does work for other buttons) Hand becomes a fist and it sounds like something was selected but nothing else happens. I try fondling them. I try stroking them. Punching. Slapping. One at a time and both at once... nothing seems to do anything. 

So... yes... for a free demo it was a nice looking menu. I'm not a fan of the slideshow tutorial (I prefer jumping into the game engine and trying it out using the guide to tell me what does what) but that's probably a matter of taste. 

But I was kind of expecting to be able to jump into the mech and at least look around from the cockpit? At least something other than the, admittedly, neat menu... 

:|
I dont know how to play

Just played it for the first time in PVP.  I was in a giant mech, and the target reticles moved with my touch remote.  We were leaping around over buildings in one leap and firing while mid leap.  Awesome experience.
The only complaint I'd have is the steep system reqs.  Even with graphics turned all the way down, was a little choppy.
I encourage the developer to come up with more game modes (both COOP and PVP).  This game has super potential and has restored my faith in VR.

review_title: Best mech game i have tested in VR
one_reviews_text:
great idea from developers to open pvp for all. finding games is easier, and for sure increases sales.

Game is solid. controls are good and action fun.
Only thing i would hope this free version would have is, some kind on tutorial game. Now jumping to the game totally unexperienced can leave a bad taste. especially when playing against seasoned pilots
Matchmaking don't work, but the game is wanderfoul!

The gameplay is a solid 4 out of 5 and when the teams are even it's a really fun game (and FREE!). The problem is the matchmaking and I guess it being free is part of the problem. You get alot of ppl leaving after they have died once since I'm guessing they are just testing it out. That gets kind of frustrating after a few times since it often takes quite a while to get matched up with another player. If matchmaking is improved I'll give it the 4 stars.

Ok it was free,  and intially I  didn't understand the nature of the 4 digit key (which is a good way of locating a server) but we wanted to play on our own as PVP, so we could evaluate the game mechanics with a view to buying the full game (decent co-ops are few and far between)but it seemed to let others join. Developer has responded so I'm going to  give them the benefit of the doubt and up my rating to 3 stars, re-install it, and try it again later (I was sure I picked the option to play without guests).
Update: No ability to play 1v1 to test it? Rating back down to 1
Update 2: Dev reckons 1v1 is playabla so I will re-install it yet again to try but TBH  it seemed to imply that 4 was the minimum no to play a private game (and no way I'm going to sign up to yet another forum to seek help)
review_feedback:
You may have clicked the button to open the game to others. Please do let us know if this was not the case as it would be the first report of such an issue.

UPDATE: It should really be easy to play 1v1 and 1v2 to test. Strange you are having these issues. Join our discord and we can help you out! https://discord.gg/WvZ68E
